imagehandling

Class TextOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagehandling.TextOptions

  • public class TextOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    The TextOptions are used to define the Search and Return options for the getAttribute methods of volume and Image.

    The Static int values, are 7,8,9. If you use the returnexpression, than you should evoid these values.

    Author:
    dridder_local

      static int ATTRIBUTE_NAME
      TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_NUMBER represents the Attribute name in the searchoption, aswell as in the returnexpression.

      TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_NUMBER represents the Attribute number in the searchoption, aswell as in the returnexpression.
      static int ATTRIBUTE_VALUE
      TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_NUMBER represents the Attribute value in the searchoption, aswell as in the returnexpression.

    • Method Detail

      • setReturnExpression

        public void setReturnExpression(java.lang.String returnexp)
        The ReturnExpression defines, what the getAttribute method should return. For example:

        TextOptions topt = new TextOptions();

        topt.setReturnExpression(TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_NUMBER + " "+ TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_NAME + ": "+ TextOptions.ATTRIBUTE_VALUE);

        System.out.println(vol.getAttribute("echo"));

        Output:

        0018,0081 Echo Time: 3.3

        0018,0086 Echo Numbers(s): 1

        0018,0091 Echo Train Length: 1

        Parameters:
        returnexp -

      • getReturnExpression

        public java.lang.String getReturnExpression()
        This method returns the String, which defines the output of a getAttribute method.

      • getSearchOptions

        public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> getSearchOptions()
        This method returns the searchoptions. The HashSet is not copyd.

      • setSearchOptions

        public void setSearchOptions(int[] textoptionsvalues)
        With this method, you can set all searchoptions directly.

        textoptionsvalues -
